name: cognitonaut
text: I love the hangover face ray does, in this and also in the post L.I.N.C.O.L.N. debacle. I often make this face.

name: gormster
text: You mean post Goth debacle. This is post L.I.N.C.O.L.N.

name: ford
text: A comment left by ford was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, king_of_pwns, antecen)

name: rosie
text: Ahh, the luxury of skipping a day. I get that feeling every morning when my alarm clock goes off. Then I have to get up anyway.

name: antsama
text: Roast Beef is still sporting a most L.I.N.C.O.L.N. beard.

name: stuart
text: since it rhymes most people would call that poetry but you know whatever

name: cicadalek
text: I would pay good money to get my hands on the contents of that notebook.

name: wulvaine
text: I think Onstad should write and sell this notebook in the bookstore. I would buy a copy.

name: cdl146
text: I myself have had to skip a day or two. Happens to the best of us.

name: honesttom
text: This is the very essence of the Morning After.

name: mountaindewtab
text: oh man ray look like he is in his death throes

name: phthoggos
text: I love Ray's frozen death-hangover posture.

name: jthm_guitarist
text: I'm going to have to start saying "what in the dogg" now.

name: red-barchetta
text: Ray looks as dead as a dried up bug on a window sill. Classic.

name: professorriffs
text: If all the frames in this were blank but it still had the last one intact, I would still give it five Beefs.

name: desert_donkey
text:
PHAT. i never saw this one.

makes me think of the Sublime song.. i ain't gettin' outta bed today. so poignant.
